title: Geometric representations of the braid group on a nonorientable surface
abstract:
We classify homomorphisms from the braid group on $n$ strands to the pure
mapping class group of a nonoriantable surface of genus $g$. For $n\ge 14$ and
$g\le 2\lfloor{n/2}\rfloor+1$ every such homomorphism is either cyclic, or it
maps standard generators of the braid group to either distinct Dehn twists, or
distinct crosscap transpositions, possibly multiplied by the same element of
the centralizer of the image.
